Loading relevant packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggstatsplot)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv") 
```
:::


Applying [ggstatsplot](https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/ggstatsplot/)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

# Using parametric for histogram
p <- gghistostats(data = exam,   
             x = ENGLISH,   
             type = "parametric",   
             test.value = 60,   
             bin.args = list(color = "black",                   
                             fill = "grey 50",                   
                             alpha = 0.7),  
             normal.curve = FALSE,   
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),   
             xlab = "English scores" )

## 4 Types of distribution - Parametric, non-parametric, robust (exclude outliers), bayes
p
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Extracting out tibblr
extract_stats(p)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

::: panel-tabset
## Non-parametric


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gghistostats(data = exam,   
             x = ENGLISH,   
             type = "non-parametric",   
             test.value = 60,   
             bin.args = list(color = "black",                   
                             fill = "grey 50",                   
                             alpha = 0.7),  
             normal.curve = FALSE,   
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),   
             xlab = "English scores" )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Robust


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gghistostats(data = exam,   
             x = ENGLISH,   
             type = "robust",   
             test.value = 60,   
             bin.args = list(color = "black",                   
                             fill = "grey 50",                   
                             alpha = 0.7),  
             normal.curve = FALSE,   
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),   
             xlab = "English scores" )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Bayes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gghistostats(data = exam,   
             x = ENGLISH,   
             type = "bayes",   
             test.value = 60,   
             bin.args = list(color = "black",                   
                             fill = "grey 50",                   
                             alpha = 0.7),  
             normal.curve = FALSE,   
             normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 2),   
             xlab = "English scores" )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

:::

[ggwithinstats](https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/ggstatsplot/articles/web_only/ggwithinstats.html)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Reformatting dataset such that each record includes: Student, Subject, Score. 

exam_long <- exam %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    cols = ENGLISH:SCIENCE, 
    names_to = "SUBJECT", 
    values_to = "SCORES") %>%
  filter(CLASS == "3A")


# Comparing across 3 subjects
p1 <- ggwithinstats(
  data = exam_long, 
  x = SUBJECT,
  y = SCORES,
  type = "p",
)

p1
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Plotting to include reference line that compares the student details side by side. 
ggwithinstats(
  data = filter(exam_long, SUBJECT %in% c('MATHS', 'SCIENCE')), 
  x = SUBJECT, 
  y = SCORES, 
  type = "p"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Filtering to math and science 
```
:::


Scatterplot with histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggscatterstats(
  data = exam, 
  x = MATHS, 
  y = ENGLISH, 
  marginal = TRUE, 
  label.var = ID, 
  label.expression = ENGLISH > 90 & MATHS > 90)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
